title: Diagnostics: help text for missing left-hand side in arbitrary self type

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

body:
Forgetting to include the left-hand side of an arbitrary self type can give some confusing errors. This was reported by someone trying to implement a future manually, and the diagnostics threw them off.

I realize diagnostics for arbitrary self types are an open issue, but figured I'd include this variant as to not overlook it. Thanks!

[Link to playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=7ade654ee894018a51de5d4d3dcff90d)

## Code
```rust
pub fn hello(Box<Self>) {}
```

## Expected
```txt
error: expected one of `:` or `@`, found `<`
 --> src/lib.rs:1:17
  |
1 | pub fn hello(Box<Self>) {}
  |              ^ expected one of `:` or `@` here
  |
help: if this is a `self` type, give it a parameter name
  |
1 | pub fn hello(self: Box<Self>) {}
  |              ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

error: aborting due to previous error
```

## Current
```txt
error: expected one of `:` or `@`, found `<`
 --> src/lib.rs:1:17
  |
1 | pub fn hello(Box<Self>) {}
  |                 ^ expected one of `:` or `@` here

error: aborting due to previous error
```
